title: Power Stick deodorant recall: What you need to know
summary: Power Stick deodorant has been recalled — here’s what you need to know
story: When it comes to deodorant, picking the right formula is a personal decision. Some people prefer antiperspirants (which help stop sweating) and others opt for deodorants (which mask bad smells). But one thing we’re confident about is that nobody wants to use a deodorant that's been recalled, which is why we are sharing this news: The Food and Drug Administration has issued a recall on 67,000 cases of Power Stick antiperspirant.
Below, find more details on what this recall means and a list of deodorants you can use instead.
Why were Power Stick deodorants recalled?
According to the FDA, 67,000 cases of Power Stick deodorant have been recalled. The recall was initiated on July 10, and it applies to the following products from the brand:

Power Stick for Her Roll-On Antiperspirant Deodorant Powder Fresh, 1.8 oz/ 53 mL UPC Code 815195019313Power Stick Invisible Protection Roll-On Antiperspirant Deodorant Spring Fresh, 1.8 oz/53 mL UPC Code 815195018194Power Stick Original Nourishing Invisible Protection Roll-On Antiperspirant Deodorant, 1.8 oz/53 mL UPC Code 815195018224
Power Stick for Her Roll-On Antiperspirant Deodorant Powder Fresh, 1.8 oz/ 53 mL UPC Code 815195019313
Power Stick Invisible Protection Roll-On Antiperspirant Deodorant Spring Fresh, 1.8 oz/53 mL UPC Code 815195018194
Power Stick Original Nourishing Invisible Protection Roll-On Antiperspirant Deodorant, 1.8 oz/53 mL UPC Code 815195018224
There was no specific reason given for the recall, only that the items were recalled for deviating from Current Good Manufacturing Practices — a set of standards established by the FDA.

Power Stick deodorant is sold at Dollar Tree, Walmart and on Amazon. No information has been given on what to do if you have already purchased one of these products, though it is usually recommended that you stop using anything that has been recalled.
Other deodorants to use instead

If the recall impacted your deodorant or you just happen to be in the market for something new, we curated some helpful recommendations below. All of them are deodorants we have either previously recommended or are formulas with high ratings.
Certain Dri Deodorant

NBC Select Senior Manager of Community Engagement Rosalie Sparaco, who considers herself a “very sweaty person” went on a deodorant testing mission two years ago. She was looking for a formula that she could use while wearing a heavy ball gown on her wedding day and after trying a few options from Amazon, she landed on this and has been using it ever since. “This one was the absolute best,” she says. “It always keeps me physically dry without smelling all day long, and will even last until the next morning. It really does stay effective that long. I recommend it to anyone for their wedding day, for the summer, or even if they just sweat a lot.”
Lume Whole Body Deodorant
Use it all overLong-lasting
Use it all over
Long-lasting

Must be applied with fingers

NBC Select associate SEO reporter Ashley Morris wasn’t sure she’d like a whole body deodorant, but wound up loving this one after trying it — so much so, she wrote an entire review about it. “I can wear this deodorant through a full day at the office, an evening workout and cooking dinner without even a hint of odor,” she says. It protects against odor for up to 72 hours and you can use it all over your body, according to the brand.
Dove Beauty Clear Finish Antiperspirant & Deodorant Dry Spray

For those who prefer a spray, Dove makes a great option. It dries clear and has 48-hour protection, according to the brand. It also comes in several scents, so you can choose one that best suits your preferences. Hold it six inches away from your underarm and apply it in two to three short bursts.

It has 15% aluminum chloride (the highest strength available over-the-counter) to help stop sweating, according to the brand. It is fragrance-free and offers 72-hour protection. title: Taylor Swift Reviews ‘Happy Gilmore 2’— With Subtle Nod to Travis Kelce’s Shirtless Scene
summary: “Happy Gilmore 2” has the official Taylor Swift stamp of approval.
story: “Happy Gilmore 2” has the official Taylor Swift stamp of approval.

Swift shared a glowing review of the “Happy Gilmore” sequel to her Instagram story July 25. The “Cruel Summer” posted the movie's poster alongside a short message about the film, which included an appearance from her boyfriend, Travis Kelce.
“Happy Gilmore 2 had me cackling and cheering the whole movie!” Swift wrote on the post. “An absolute must watch, 13/10, go watch it on @netflix as soon as humanly possible. 🍯”
The honey pot emoji at the end of Swift's post appeared to be a subtle nod to Kelce’s role in the movie.
“Happy Gilmore 2” was chock-full of celebrities, including Bad Bunny, Post Malone, Eminem, Margaret Qualley, Ken Jennings, Haley Joel Osment and the Kansas City Chiefs tight end.

In the sequel, Kelce portrays a waiter at a restaurant where Adam Sandler’s character, Happy Gilmore, is dining. Happy overhears Kelce’s character unfairly scold and fire a busboy named Oscar, played by Bad Bunny.

Happy later ends up hiring Oscar as his caddy after he forgets to bring one with him to the tour championship. At one point during a match, Happy suggests that Oscar go to his “happy place,” which includes Kelce’s character tied to a light post. Oscar then slathers his naked chest in honey straight from a pot before leaving the waiter to be attacked by a bear.

After “Happy Gilmore 2” hit Netflix July 25, Kelce shared a post on social media to celebrate the premiere with a series of behind-the-scenes photos from the set, including snaps with both Sandler and Bad Bunny.

“Man this life is crazy!! Still so surreal I got this opportunity,” Kelce wrote in the caption. “@adamsandler SANDMAN!! Thank you brotha, for the opportunity and for giving us all Happy Gilmore 2! Everybody go check it out right now!”
The Chiefs tight end wasn’t the only member of the Kelce family to appear in “Happy Gilmore 2,” either.
Sandler appeared as a guest on a recent episode of Kelce's podcast “New Heights." During the episode, Kelce revealed that his dad, Ed, also made an appearance in the movie.

“Your dad was smooth as hell,” Sandler said. “I was telling you guys he’s in loads of shots. I think it’s when you cut to either me or Lee Trevino, you see Ed and he’s always right in the shot looking cool as hell, looking like a proud member of the gold jacket club. I don’t know what year your father in the movie won the gold jacket, but he wore it proudly and he was cool as hell.”

The NFL star has been active on social media amid the release of his latest onscreen endeavor. On July 24, he posted a carousel of photos with Swift, which marked the first time he's shared photos of his girlfriend on Instagram.
In addition to the pictures of Swift and Kelce together, eagle-eyed fans also noticed that they both seemingly had photos of each other as their lock screens.

title: How Adam Sandler’s ‘Happy Gilmore 2’ Includes His Late Onscreen Son Cameron Boyce
summary: Adam Sandler's new movie, "Happy Gilmore 2" includes a sweet homage to his late "Grown Ups" co-star Cameron Boyce, who died in 2019 at age 20.
story: Adam Sandler's new movie, "Happy Gilmore 2," includes a sweet homage to his late "Grown Ups" co-star Cameron Boyce.

About 14 minutes into the film, Sandler's character, Happy Gilmore, is seen approaching a check-in booth with golf clubs in hand. Two people are seen watching a show from a television set behind the counter, and a brief glimpse of the screen features Boyce.
The Easter egg appears to be from an episode of Boyce's hit Disney Channel show "Jessie," where he played Luke Ross from 2011 to 2015.
Boyce died in 2019 at age 20.
Online, fans caught the moment in "Happy Gilmore 2" and said it was a lovely tribute.
"I love the fact Adam Sandler put that quick shot of Cameron Boyce on the tv in #happygilmore2," one person wrote on X.
"This is so touching," another said.

Boyce and Sandler first worked together on the 2010 comedy "Grown Ups," where Boyce played one of the comedian's sons. Then, in 2013, they reprised their roles as dad Lenny and son Keithie Feder for "Grown Ups 2."
In 2019, Boyce died in his sleep from a seizure caused by epilepsy. He was 20.

“The world is now undoubtedly without one of its brightest lights, but his spirit will live on through the kindness and compassion of all who knew and loved him,” his family said in a statement to "E! News" at the time.
After Boyce's death, Sandler shared a tribute to the young actor, writing in part, "‪Too young. Too sweet. Too funny. Just the nicest, most talented, and most decent kid around."
The credits of Sandler's 2020 film "Hubie Halloween" also featured a tribute to Boyce.

“In loving memory of Cameron Boyce," the tribute read. "Gone way too soon and one of the kindest, coolest, funniest, and most talented kids we knew. You live on forever in our hearts and are truly missed every day."

title: Ashley Judd Shares 3-Word Message About Body Image and Menopause While Wearing Swimsuit
summary: Ashley Judd sharing a empowering message while wearing a one-piece swimsuit at the beach.
story: Ashley Judd is living by three words: “I don’t care.”

On July 22, Judd shared a video on Instagram embracing her “inner child” in the Baltic Sea before proudly declaring herself a member of the “We Do Not Care” movement, which was founded by content creator Melani Sanders.

While donning a one-piece swimsuit in the water, Judd told the camera, “Hi, I’m Ashley and I am a member of the We Don’t Care club and when I’m in my swimsuit, sometimes I get a little chaffing like right down there, so I put on cornstarch,” she said, motioning to her inner thighs.
Judd called it a “good trick,” but noted that if anyone saw “a white thing there,” she truly does not care.

“And I have a jellyfish,” she added, showing off the animal in her cupped hands. “It’s a non-stinging kind and I think the central nervous system is that part and that may not be right, and I don’t care because there’s another club that my inner child belongs to and that’s called the MSU club.”
Judd explained that the MSU club stands for "Make Stuff Up" club and that it was for "inner children."
"As a postmenopausal woman, I don’t really care if you don’t like the MSU Club for inner children,” she added.

Judd went on to show off a series of water “tricks,” including dipping her head into the water and flipping her hair back over to form a dramatic roll, before later doing a belly flop, back flip and handstand in the water.
As Judd walked back further into the water, she noted, “Oh, I probably have cellulite. I don’t care, and I got hungry bum, and I don’t care.”
Judd emphasized her carefree message in the caption, calling the experience of menopause “human biology” and “universal.”
“What can be a hope of ‘We Don’t Care Club?’” she wrote. “What will I, with my freedom & mirth, when I let go of caring about stupid, controlling norms about my female body, be free to enJOY?”
She encouraged her followers to “play,” “be silly,” “have fun” and “feel boundless joy.”
“I bask in the unselfconscious being-ness of my True Self,” she said. “My Inner Child is free to emerge. She feels confidence & glee.”

Judd also shared a message encouraging her followers to look inward, adding, “If you let yourself be free, how would your True Self & Inner Child spend your Carefree Timelessness? How can you let go of what others expect, think, need, want? What do YOU feel, need, want, from yourself?”
She also highlighted the importance of the “Make Stuff Up Club,” noting the “beautiful, creative imaginations” of inner children.

“They want to be seen, heard, be safe, & play,” she said. “If as an adult, I am caught up in what others think of me, I ignore, neglect, & abandon my own tender Self. Today, that’s off the table. Into the Sea for me, to splash & play.”
Over the years, Judd has not shied away from addressing her personal life, including public discussion about her weight gain after her mother Naomi Judd died in April 2022.
Speaking to Dr. Jonathan Flint in October 2022, she revealed experienced another fracture in her leg over the summer after she shattered her leg in Congo in February 2021.

“And then, since my mom and everything, I’ve put on some weight, and I’m sure people are talking about it, but I don’t pay any attention to it because I know it’s a temporary condition, and the weight will come off when it’s supposed to because it is none of my business what people think of me,” she explained.
Judd said she was “sure that there is a cohort of people who are being vilely ugly” about photos she posted at her sister Wynonna Judd's concert, calling public scrutiny “none of my business.”

“I have a healthy boundary about it, but ... you try being a once ultra-fit woman who’s 54 and put on some weight. That is going to spark some very sexist conversation, by both men and women and others in our culture,” she added.

title: Astronomer Hires Gwyneth Paltrow as 'Temporary Spokesperson' After Coldplay Concert Scandal
summary: Astronomer revealed Gwyneth Paltrow as their "temporary spokesperson" after a Coldplay concert video went viral and put the company in the spotlight.
story: Gwyneth Paltrow has landed a surprising new gig.

On July 25, Astronomer revealed in a video shared on social media that the actor and Goop founder is now their “temporary spokesperson.” Debuting in her new role at the data operations company, Paltrow answered the internet’s most-talked-about questions.
Thanking people for their interest in Astronomer, the actor begins by saying she’s “been hired on a very temporary basis to speak on behalf of the 300-plus employees” at the company.
“Astronomer has gotten a lot of questions over the last few days, and they wanted me to answer the most common ones,” she continues, as the first question appears.
“OMG! What the actual f,” it reads, before Paltrow chimes in with her answer.

“Yes, Astronomer is the best place to run Apache Airflow. Unifying the experience of running data, ML and AI pipelines at scale. We’ve been thrilled so many people have a newfound interest in data workflow automation,” she replies. “As for the other questions we’ve received...”
The second question then appears on the screen, which reads, “How is your social media team holding...”
Once again, Paltrow interrupts and answers, "Yes, there is still room available at our Beyond Analytics event in September."
Paltrow continues, “We will now be returning to what we do best: delivering game-changing results for our customers. Thank you for your interest in Astronomer.”

The video comes after the company has made headlines after the resignation of two of its employees. On July 19, Astronomer confirmed that CEO Andy Byron resigned from his position following a viral video from a Coldplay concert.
Additionally, the company's chief people officer, Kristin Cabot, also left her position, the data operations company confirmed to TODAY.com on July 24.
Byron and Cabot did not respond to NBC News’ request for comment.
Byron was identified by social media users as one of the people in a viral video from a July 16 Coldplay concert kiss cam. The clip shows two people embracing before abruptly hiding from the camera.
Coldplay lead singer Chris Martin — and Paltrow’s ex-husband — then joked, “Either they’re having an affair or they’re just very shy.” The moment quickly went viral.

After Byron's resignation, Pete DeJoy was announced as Astronomer's interim CEO. DeJoy issued a statement on LinkedIn about the company’s “unusual and surreal” attention it had been getting, without mentioning the viral video.
In his statement, he noted, “While I would never have wished for it to happen like this, Astronomer is now a household name.”
Meanwhile, people in the comments section of Astronomer’s video with Paltrow praised the company for its creativity.
“Gwyneth Paltrow is Chris Martin’s ex wife. 10/10 PR move,” one person wrote, while another added, “INSANE TO GET CHRIS MARTIN’S EX.”
“Apologies, I was unfamiliar with your game 🔥 Give your social and PR team their due!!!! And a few well-earned days off!” someone commented.
“brilliant and very funny!!! kudos to PR team. I’d buy whatever you’re selling!” read another message.

title: Owen Thiele Grew Up Loving Sitcom Couples. Now He Stars in One of the Internet's Favorite Ships
summary: Owen Thiele discusses starring in "Overcompensating" and "Adults," which premiered just weeks apart, and previews his own comedy show, "Off Color."
story: In FX’s “Adults,” Owen Thiele plays Anton, the “friend slut” of the group.

Episode 3 of the Gen Z take on the “eclectic group of New York City roommates trope” sees the 20-something crew deal with a stabber in their Queens neighborhood. And the wanted sign posted on their block features the suspect smiling and waving to none other than one of their own.

Anton and the alleged stabber had exchanged phone numbers and made weekly dinner plans. After, his roommates force him to go through his texts, where they find hundreds of chummy brief exchanges with contacts like, “Briana Acupuncture Student” or “Leather jacket Newsies chorus.”
“The phone episode is very me,” Thiele tells TODAY.com. “To the point where I was like, we might as well just use my real phone.”

Thiele has previously called himself a “nepo friend,” due to his past experience landing roles in projects created by his friends. For example: Thiele went to high school with “Theater Camp” writer and star Molly Gordon before playing head of costumes Gigi Charbonier in 2023. Before 2025’s “Overcompensating,” series’ creator Benito Skinner — who wrote the show in part based on his own early 2010s college experience — was “already my best friend,” Thiele says.

But with “Adults,” an eight-episode comedy series helmed by executive producer Nick Kroll, Thiele landed a starring role, building a character he could “infuse” himself into and becoming one-half of one of entertainment’s most beloved phenomena: the sitcom ship.

“Nick Kroll did a fake out where he told us that we were getting on a Zoom to do another round of auditions, but really it was to tell us that we got the role — it was that moment where I was like, ‘I actually booked something, not through a friend who I forced to put me in something,’” Thiele says.
“That was the moment that I really felt like, ‘I can do this,’” he adds.

Below, Thiele, 28, discusses his breakout summer, that surprising kiss between Anton and Paul Baker (or “Panton,” as fans have dubbed them) and previews what viewers can expect from his own show, “Off Color,” a semi-autobiographical comedy about family.
This interview has been lightly edited for clarity.
'Overcompensating' premiered in May. Weeks later, 'Adults' dropped. How would you describe the past few months?

It is surreal. It is the most insane — it’s a dream of all dreams. Every time I feel like I’m looking for synonyms in my head for the word whirlwind. It’s just been a whirlwind of joy. It was so amazing to make both shows. I feel like both of the shows that I’m in I got very lucky with the cast and the crew. “Adults” I didn’t know anyone when I started, but they’ve become my best friends, and “Overcompensating,” I knew Benny really well, and he was already my best friend. So it’s just working with friends, which I think you always hear about, but it rarely happens.
'Overcompensating' has been celebrated for embracing millennial culture, whereas 'Adults' has been billed as for Gen Z. Which generation do you identify with?

Well, I’m a cusper. I’m an honest, true cusper. I remember watching “Girls” and being like, “This is me.” And then now I’m watching TikToks of these 19 year olds, and I’m like, “Oh, my God, that’s totally me.” So I feel like I can kind of straddle both worlds.
How would you sum up the difference between the generations' styles of humor?

I think “Overcompensating” is in the world of “Wet Hot American Summer,” these movies that we loved growing up, which just feel fun and camp. It’s so relatable. I dropped out of college after two weeks ... but even still, I was like, “I know a Hailee. I know a Grace.” I knew every character. I feel like the humor is really based in relatability.

And with “Adults,” what I think they do so brilliantly is they take from the Gen Z sensibility of ... it’s just joke after joke. I feel like now with TikTok, we’re so used to this fast paced, joke-after-joke lifestyle. I remember watching a TikTok the other day and it was a minute long. The joke didn’t come until the end and I was like, “This is so boring.” I’m so used to, like, 10 seconds in there’ll be a joke, 20 seconds in, another.
On your TikTok, you've engaged a lot with fans of the show. What was your approach to putting Anton into your social media?

For me, I think what was fun about the social media aspect is, a lot of who I am as a person is also in Anton. So it was really fun to even just post something that Owen would post and people would be like, “This is so Anton.” I was like, is that a compliment? Are you roasting me, or are you being super nice?
People have really taken to the Anton and Paul Baker plot line, which I think is so beautiful. It’s so cheesy to say this but it really makes me feel like, “Oh, people love, love. Love wins.”

Also, it’s so fun to tease because I don’t know what’s going to happen in the next season. On my own TikTok, I’m like, “Well, what if this happened?” Then I see the reaction and I’m like, “OK, that can’t happen because everyone hated that TikTok.” I feel like the creators, too, are learning from the way that we have our own special communication with the people watching it. And it feels like we’re just all in a friend group. They’re like, “Wait, Issa (Amita Rao) needs a girlfriend in Season 2!” And (creators) Ben (Kronengold) and Rebecca (Shaw) are so brilliant, I feel like they will hear that and take the people watching opinions, because it matters.
Does your phone look like Anton's?

So this is what happened. I'm just gonna tell you it straight. (Laughs). So Episode 1, the pilot, when I auditioned, Anton was struggling with dating as he is in the season, but he was a little more emotionally reserved and a little more cutting. Then as we built this character together, they kind of infused a little bit of my people-pleasing aspects into Anton. So then it became a mix of what they had brilliantly written before, and also a little bit of Owen as well — I just used my name in the third person ... I cannot believe I just did it.

But yeah, they infuse Anton with me. For instance, the phone episode is very me to the point where I was like, we might as well just use my real phone. We didn’t, thank God. But yes, if you look at my phone, it’s like, “Car Accident No. 4,” like, “Gray Socks Guy From Bar.”

Right now I have probably 2,000 unread text messages. But I would like to say that my mother is worse than me and meets people on the street and puts me in group chats with random people. So that's why I have so many unread texts, because my mom will go to a 7-Eleven, meet someone and put me in a group chat with this person and all of his family.

"Adults" opens with Issa's boyfriend, the Canadian, sexually fluid Paul Baker (Jack Innanen), moving into the house. He and Anton strike up a close friendship. In the season's finale, Paul Baker learns his visa's expiring, so Issa proposes. After she gets cold feet, their other housemates Samir (Malik Elassal) and Billie (Lucy Freyer) also offer to marry him.
The final scene reveals that Paul Baker and Anton got married. At their roommates' urging, they share a kiss that turns more than platonic. But before anyone can react, the power goes out.
I want to talk about the ending. At the civil wedding ceremony, did Anton volunteer to marry Paul Baker, or did Paul Baker ask Anton to marry him at that moment?
I don't know why, I just got a full chill down my spine. I felt like Anton in this moment.

I probably think, based on who Anton is — a little more emotionally reserved, emotionally stunted and scared of love — I don't think he volunteered. But I think he was so beyond happy when he was asked. That's what I would say.
What has your experience been diving into this fandom?

We'll do anything to make people watch the show. We love it so much that we're like, we will literally read fan fiction if you just turn on the TV. It's been amazing because it feels like everyone watching it and everyone interacting with us online are loving these characters and the stories as much as we did when we were making it. It feels like we’re a little community of people... a group of people that I would get along with.

I love reading all of people’s theories about Paul Baker and Anton, or Samir and Billie, or what Issa is going to do. I’ve never been on a television show that has that. I feel so lucky to be a part of it because I’ve been on the other end for so many shows like that, where I was secretly on my finsta (“fake Instagram,” or a secondary social media account), writing comments about what would happen in the next season of whatever show I’m talking about.
So you were a fan of ship culture?

I love ship culture. (Laughs). I love it. “New Girl” was a big one for me. Nick and Jess, I was shipping. There’s been so many. I remember re-watching “Friends” during COVID. And I was like, “Oh my God. I love Rachel and Ross.” I love a sitcom ship, I really do.
After that kiss, after they deal with the power going out, what happens next?
Here's my theory, and I've never really said this, and maybe I'll get absolutely killed for saying it, but I think they're all going to make it through.

I think Issa and Anton have such a beautiful friendship, and Amita and I actually have mimicked that in real life. We actually are the best of friends. She's gonna be a bridesmaid in my wedding, like, that's the kind of friend she's become to me. So I do feel like, if that happened in real life with Amita and I, we would make it through. I probably wouldn't do it, but we would make it through. So I think everything's gonna be OK, but I do think, of course, there will be some hiccups.
We know Paul Baker has expressed that he thinks Anton's 'the coolest person in the world.' How does Anton view Paul Baker?
I think Anton has finally found someone who he connects to on a level that he's been searching for. But it is just so scary that that person is your best friend's boyfriend.

So I think either this will change him for the better. Maybe he will be more vocal about his feelings, or this will set him back 20 more years. He will never say anything again. Let's hope for the first.

While releasing “Overcompensating” and “Adults,” Thiele has also been working on his own show, “Off Color,” about his relationship with his parents, who adopted him. The show includes executive producer Ilana Glazer.

Per The Hollywood Reporter, the logline reads, “He’s gay and Black, they’re all Jewish, his mom should be on ‘Real Housewives’ and his cousin’s a former party girl turned Rabbi-in-training. The comedy is about a son who doesn’t want to grow up, a mother who has no intention of letting him, and a dad who’s probably faking a nap in the other room so he doesn’t have to engage.”
How is the development of 'Off Color' going?

We are chugging along. Our little team, all these people that I’ve looked up to for so long; Kent Alterman and Sarah Babineau were the heads of Comedy Central who greenlit my favorite shows ever, “Broad City” included. And then Ilana, who is a comedy legend and one of my deepest and biggest role models. So it kind of feels crazy to just even work with them.
So we're chugging along, and hopefully something will happen soon.
Thinking of the premise of 'Off Color,' how do you approach putting yourself into a role? Is it natural for you?

Yeah, it is natural — because I’m such a narcissist. No, no, but it is natural. What’s so funny about writing about my family is that my family is so beautifully insane. I’ll write something and Ilana will read it and be like, “Oh, this could not happen.” And I said, “No, no, it just happened two minutes ago, which is why I’m texting you. ... My mother really did this in the grocery store.”
That's why it's so fun, because it feels like family therapy. It feels like I'm journaling about the craziest things that my parents could do. But somehow it's all real.

title: Carly Pearce Goes Instagram Official With New Boyfriend: 'What the Kids Call a 'Hard Launch''
summary: Carly Pearce is going public with the new man in her life
story: Carly Pearce is going public with the new man in her life.
The country music star, 35, shared a selfie on Instagram that showed her smiling as she cozied up to her boyfriend, whom  People identified as entrepreneur Jordan Karcher.
"I guess this is what the kids call a 'hard launch' these days…," Pearce joked in her caption, adding a smiling and heart emoji.
For his part, Karcher previously tagged Pearce in a post about how he’d “finally” become a fan of country music. He later changed his Instagram account settings to private.

Pearce's confirmation of the couple's romance comes a little more than five years after she and her ex-husband, fellow country music star Michael Ray, announced their split in June 2020 after eight months of marriage.
The former couple, who collaborated on the 2020 duet, “Finish Your Sentences,” went public with their relationship in late 2018.

Following her split with Ray, Pearce dated Nashville real estate agent Riley King for two years before entering into an unexpected romance with her drummer BC Taylor in the summer of 2023, People reported.
“I certainly never thought I would find myself in this situation,” Pearce told the publication, “but it just happened. I’m happy. It’s good.”
The “What He Didn’t Do” singer later followed up by telling People in June 2024 that she preferred to keep her relationship with Taylor private.
“Everything’s good,” she said. “But now that I’ve had a failed marriage and a failed relationship in the spotlight, I have learned we keep this one very quiet.”
Pearce added that she would be happy if “love and marriage and whatever ‘family’ looks like for me,” were in the cards for her future, but said she considered making music her top priority.
“I am really OK if children do not happen for me, meaning this is what I’ve wanted more,” she said. “My career is what I dreamt of.”

title: 'Evita' Alternate Bella Brown Gets Standing Ovation (and Takes 10 Bows!) After Rachel Zegler Has To Exit Mid-Show
summary: Audiences at the West End's London Palladium theater were treated to a rare "two Eva" performance of "Evita" on July 24
story: Audiences at the West End's London Palladium theater were treated to a rare "two Eva" performance of "Evita" on July 24.
Bella Brown made musical magic this week in London when she took over the lead role of Eva Perón midway through Thursday's performance after the show's star, Rachel Zegler, fell ill, per People.
As Zegler's alternate, Brown gave a "powerhouse" performance as Eva in Act 2 of the stripped down revival of the Andrew Lloyd Webber musical, which premiered at the London Palladium on June 14.
Brown started the show in her usual role of the Mistress, but after intermission, she wowed audience members with a knockout rendition of Eva's signature ballad, “Don’t Cry for Me Argentina."

The Jamie Lloyd-directed production notably brings the show beyond the stage. During each performance, Evita sings her signature ballad from the theater’s balcony to crowds gathered on Argyll Street, while the moment is broadcast inside to theatergoers.

Brown was scheduled to play Eva Perón four times during the production's run, but on July 24, she stepped up to the plate after intermission to fill in for Zegler, whose breakout roles include playing Maria in 2021’s “West Side Story” and Lucy Gray Baird in “The Hunger Games: The Ballad of Songbirds and Snakes." (Zegler was set to return for the July 25 performance of "Evita," her rep confirmed to the Hollywood Reporter Friday.)
“What a lucky audience getting to see both myself and my angel Reg Zeg!!” Brown wrote on her Instagram story after Thursday's show.
Fans lauded Brown with a nearly five-minute standing ovation and shared videos from her balcony performance and curtain call to Instagram, which Brown re-shared to her own Instagram story.
At the end of the show, the crowd's cheers went on for so long that Brown and her fellow cast members bowed 10 times onstage.
"You were AMAZING. Well done on stepping in so last minute," one audience member wrote over a video of Brown beginning to take her bows.
"TEN BOWS because the ovation went on that long," wrote another, adding, "BRAVO @bellaelupiabrown for stepping into Evita mid show and I hope @rachelzegler gets well soon!"
Another fan captioned an image of Brown, "A superstar!"
Many noted that they felt "lucky" to have seen both Zegler and Brown shine onstage on the same night.
"@rachelzegler for the first half and @bellaelupiabrown for the second half," wrote one.
"Two phenomenal performances by two incredibly talented women," gushed another.
Brown wrote that she was “proud” to have filled in for Zegler.
“Today really showed just how important swings and covers are within this industry,” Brown shared in a message to her Instagram story. “They are pillars of a show!! A proud day to be at 'Evita.'"

"Evita" is playing at the London Palladium on the heels of Lloyd's revival of "Sunset Boulevard," which opened on Broadway in October 2024 after a successful West End run. Nicole Scherzinger notably won a Laurence Olivier Award and Tony Award for best actress in a musical for her performance as Norma Desmond.
"Evita" will run in London until Sept. 6.

title: Brooke Hogan's Husband Says Hulk Hogan's Death Has Been a 'Challenging' Time
summary: Brooke Hogan's husband Steven Oleksy shares words of grief following her estranged father, Hulk Hogan's, death.
story: As Brooke Hogan privately grieves the death of her father, late wrestling icon Hulk Hogan, her husband Steven Oleksy has issued words of gratitude to those offering support.

In a July 24 post shared to his Instagram story, Oleksy — a former professional ice hockey player who married Brooke Hogan in 2022 — reflected on the kindness he and his wife have received in the aftermath of her father's death.
“Thank you for the love and support for my beautiful wife,” Oleksy, 39, wrote. “We are incredibly lucky to have you in our lives — not just during this challenging time, but always.”
Oleksy's post was a reshare of another Instagram story, shared by Ashley Menendez, who appeared in Brooke Hogan's 2008 VH1 reality series, "Brooke Knows Best."

"My dear sweet friend @mizzhogan lost her father today. He died knowing what I know, Brooke loved him deeply; was fiercely loyal and only ever wanted him to be peaceful, happy and surrounded by people who valued him for who he really was," Menendez's post reads. "He chose differently for himself, but we can still remember him as a doting father to a little girl with big dreams and a bigger heart."

Brooke Hogan, 37, and Hulk Hogan's relationship has faced challenges in recent years, including a prolonged period of estrangement. According to public claims made by her mother, Linda Hogan, in March 2025, Brook Hogan had not spoken to either of her parents — who divorced in 2009 — in the past eight years.
In response, Brook Hogan shared her perspective on the estrangement on Instagram, where she wrote that her decision “was made purely on how they have dealt with me directly my entire life.”
“I have been EXTREMELY verbally and mentally abused since childhood,” she continued in her story, adding that “Sadly, it would frequently turn physical.”
“Inside of me, there is a little girl who desperately wants and needs her Mom and Dad,” she continued. “But their behavior became more painful than their absence.”
TODAY.com reached out to both Linda Hogan and Hulk Hogan at the time for comment, and did not receive a reply.
Hulk Hogan died on July 24, 2025, after a cardiac emergency prompted a response from police and fire personnel, according to NBC News.
The wrestling icon, known for his showmanship, was married to Linda Hogan from 1983 to 2009. In addition to Brooke Hogan, who was born in 1988, the couple shares a son, Nick Hogan, born in 1990.
In 2025, Brook Hogan and Oleksy welcomed their fraternal twins, Oliver and Molly.

title: How Luis Gerardo Méndez Convinced Belinda to Be a Part of ‘Mentiras, La Serie’
summary: Luis Gerardo Méndez and Belinda talk about their work on "Mentiras, The Series," their new hit Prime Video musical series.
story: Luis Gerardo Méndez always knew he wanted Belinda to be part of “Mentiras, La Serie,” a new Prime Video series based on the hit Mexican jukebox musical “Mentiras, El Musical.”
“Beli and I connected early on,” Méndez, who stars in and executive produced the show, tells TODAY.com.
Prior to working together on “Mentiras,” which translates to “Lies,” they co-starred in another Prime Video drama, “¿Quién Lo Mató?” or “Who Killed Him?”

“I remember walking down a hall together and it was like an elevator pitch. In a minute I told her about (‘Mentiras’) and she said, ‘I’ll think about it, but it sounds really cool,’” Méndez recalls. “I couldn’t believe she agreed until the first day she was on set.”

Set in the ‘80s, the eight-episode series centers around four women — Daniela (Belinda), Dulce (Diana Bovio), Yuri (Regina Blandón) and Lupita (Mariana Treviño) — who are all connected to the recently murdered Emmanuel Mijares (Méndez). After they are summoned to a mysterious mansion, two discover that they were married to him, while the other two have secrets of their own when it comes to Emmanuel. Additional twists and hilarious turns ensue.

“Mentiras El Musical” was created by José Manuel López Velarde. The musical's — and now the show’s — success stems from the incorporation of hit Spanish pop music of the ‘80s, the likes of Amanda Miguel’s “Él Me Mintió” and Daniela Romo’s “Mentiras.” After the series was released June 13, the soundtrack debuted on Spotify’s Top 10 albums worldwide list, and at a July 10 screening, Méndez and Belinda were surprised with plaques celebrating 100 million streams.
Adding an extra element of nostalgia for viewers, the characters’ names are inspired by iconic Mexican singers Dulce, Emmanuel, Mijares, Daniela Romo, Yuri and Lupita D’Alessio.

“(Luis) hooked me with his passion when telling me about the project,” Belinda tells TODAY.com in an interview that has been translated from Spanish to English. “And then I read the scripts and began immersing myself in the story.”

Méndez, who has been working on bringing the show to life for years, recalls studios telling him musicals don't sell. He remembers attending the 2009 opening night of “Mentiras, El Musical” in Mexico and being instantly captivated by Mariana Treviño, who played Lupita in the original musical, and her presence onstage.
“‘Who is this amazing actor, I need to be her friend and I need to work with her,’” Méndez tells TODAY.com. “That is my first memory of the musical...”

By 2015, the two would co-star in the hit Netflix series “Club de Cuervos,” delighting audiences with their exaggerated and over-the-top performances as wealthy, arrogant siblings fighting over their father's soccer team.
Since the show ended in 2019, fans have been longing for a reunion — and this was it.

Chatting with TODAY.com, Méndez and Belinda spoke about the incredible production, the challenges of securing the rights to the popular songs, re-creating those hits while staying true to the original material and more.
This interview has been edited for clarity and translated from Spanish to English.
Luis, did you hand pick the cast for this show?

Luis Gerardo Méndez: Oh, yeah. What was most important was the adaptation, which was very complicated and took about four years. To create the scripts, we first needed the rights to the songs — and they were the most popular Spanish songs of the ‘80s, which was tough.

But when it came to the casting, I knew I couldn’t do it without Mariana Treviño, who played Lupita in the original musical. She wasn’t sure about returning to the role and opening Pandora’s box again (but she did). And the other person we always wanted was Belinda.

I found out we were working together on “¿Quién Lo Mató?” and I feel like we instantly connected. There’s people you meet and you just know who they are, what they’ve been through, what their goals are, what they like, what they don’t — and that’s what I felt (with Belinda).
Belinda, you've been acting since you were a child but have been focusing on your music career. How do you choose which acting projects to take on?
Belinda: The truth is, I have been sent a lot of scripts and been invited to be part of a lot of movies and shows. But I am very picky. I’m very specific in what I decide to take on.

But I loved “Mentiras” because it was a great challenge for me, not only as an actor, because this character has a wide range, but because it’s just me in a room with three incredible actresses and Luis Gerardo.

Luis Gerardo Méndez: She was holding her own alongside Mariana Treviño, Regina Blandón and Diana Bovio, who are masters of comedy. I think the great surprise was that Beli is not only an extraordinary singer and actor, which we knew, but she’s very funny and she can do comedy very well.
One thing that has done very well is the soundtrack. People have been obsessed with it.
Luis Gerardo Méndez: Not even in my wildest dreams did I imagine it would turn out so good, but it did. It’s been crazy. The songs have millions of streams on Spotify.
We had a feeling that it was going to work out but the response has been very overwhelming and kind, and we are very grateful because no one imagined it.
Was there ever any pressure to re-create these iconic songs?
Luis Gerardo Méndez: I never thought about that. I never thought about being nervous or needing to be at the same level as (singers) Mijares or Emmanuel, because I knew I was never going to be them.

These characters are singing about something very specific that they are going through at that moment. The great thing about "Mentiras" is the characters don't sing just to sing. The characters sing so that the story advances. When the character can't express what they are feeling with words, they start to sing. So it’s not me singing like Mijares, it’s me singing as my character Emmanuel. It’s not Belinda singing like Amanda Miguel, it’s Belinda singing as Daniela. And Belinda did brilliant things with her songs, like “De Color De Rosa.”
Was it always the plan to make the show look like a play and not like a television show?
Luis Gerardo Méndez: We always want to pay homage to theater and wanted it to feel very theatrical. The references we had when creating the show were “Moulin Rouge,” “La La Land” and even “Barbie.”

But we also didn't want it to be like we just filmed the original musical. We wanted to have that essence, though. Antonio Muño-Hierro, the production designer, had this brilliant idea. He said, “What’s the series called? It’s called ‘Mentiras’ (‘Lies’)’. So let’s show viewers that everything is a lie. That the sets are also fake.’”

And that’s why there’s these moments when (surprise guest) Daniela Romo says, “Everything is a lie,” and pushes the house down and you see that you’re in the Mijares household, but behind that is Daniela’s house. For me, that was beautiful. I grew up in the world of musical theater, and it’s a love letter to theater, and that’s what makes it so visually stunning.
Belinda: It's incredibly well made. It had a large budget for the sets, everything in general was well-designed, the aesthetic, cinematography, every detail was outstanding.
I think it will set a precedent, and people will be like, “Let’s make a series like ‘Mentiras.’” It will be the example for many other people, and that’s what’s incredible.

title: 'And Just Like That...' Reveals Carrie and Aidan's Fate as a Couple
summary: What happens to Carrie and Aidan in And Just Like That? Why do they break up? Here's what happens to them at the end of And Just Like That.
story: Warning: This article contains spoilers for “Present Tense,” the Season 3, Episode 9 episode of “And Just Like That,” now streaming on HBO Max.
Anyone hoping Carrie Bradshaw and Aidan Shaw would find their happily ever after in each other got their dream squashed by the end of the July 24 episode of "And Just Like That..."
After acknowledging that problems from their past had resurfaced to haunt their rekindled romance, Carrie (Sarah Jessica Parker) and Aidan (John Corbett) decided to call it quits — for good.

Aidan was forced to admit that Carrie's current friendship with her neighbor, fellow author Duncan (Jonathan Cake), had stirred up his "trust issues" that began long ago when Carrie cheated on him with Big (Chris Noth) during their characters' “Sex and the City" years.
Aidan's insecurities about Carrie's fidelity didn't sit well with Carrie given that Aidan had also recently confessed that he'd slept with his ex-wife.
The two end up ditching their lunch plans at their favorite cafe in New York City to have a blowout fight on a nearby sidewalk.
In her frustration, Carrie pointed out to Aidan that she'd "moved mountains and apartments" to be in a long-distance relationship with him while he remained in Virginia with his sons.
"I have agreed to arrangements — arrangements that even you yourself couldn't live up to. I was 100 percent in," she yelled.
“Wait, stop, was or are? Because you just said 'I was one hundred percent' in. Is it was or are you still 100 percent in?” Aidan asked.
After pausing for a moment, Carrie answered, sadly, "Was."
“I can’t give you any more than I have," Carrie said. "And it wasn’t enough. And there's all the family stuff. I'm sorry but there is."
With tears in his eyes, Aidan told Carrie, "I’m sad. I really thought we were going to make it this time."
“I’m sad too," Carrie replied before the two embraced.

"AJLT" writers Julie Rottenberg and Elisa Zuritsky —  the same duo who penned Carrie and Aidans's original breakup scene for "SATC" — opened up to Variety about writing their the couple's final scene for "Present Tense."
Rottenberg, who also directed the episode, said she and Zuritsky — who have been friends since childhood  — had "been writing these characters for so long that we know all of their Achilles’ heels."
The duo worked hard to "rebuild" Carrie and Aidan's relationship "in a way that felt new," Rottenberg told Variety.
"They had both really matured and were evolved enough to address their inherent flaws and know their pitfalls," she said.

"We wanted to give them the best shot to make it work. And the reality was, given who they both are and the situation they’re in, we built an untenable situation," she continued, adding, "But we wanted them both to have a strong argument — to be able to walk away and say, I gave it everything I could, and it didn’t work."
The writing duo also knew it was important to show how much Carrie had evolved since she and Aidan dated the first time around.

"I remember reading press last season when we got them back together — not even press, but buzz, scanning social media comments. So many people were like, She better not hurt him again, or How is she going to hurt him?" Zuritsky said.
"That was always ringing in my ears as a challenge," she added.

Being aware ahead of time that Carrie and Aidan "probably" wouldn't last in "AJLT" forced the duo to wonder, "How can we undo it in a way that left both of them with their dignity, their integrity, their love — and no one betrays anyone?"
Still, dealing with viewers' reactions always keeps the duo on their toes.

"It's wild! I can’t think of another situation where people have a real ownership and possessiveness about the character — there’s almost a blurring of the lines that they’re people viewers know and feel protective of," explained Rottenberg.
"If we write a story that portrays Carrie in a certain light, people feel That’s not my Carrie and Carrie would never put up with this," she added.

Zuritsky chimed in to add, "And sometimes there’s discomfort around the fact that they haven’t changed. I will read just as much snark about Carrie being just same old self as snark that she’s changed too much."

title: Eagle-Eyed Fans Spot Cute Detail in Pic of Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce
summary: After Travis Kelce shared new pics with girlfriend Taylor Swift, fans were quick to catch a small, intimate detail of the couple
story: After Travis Kelce shared new pics with girlfriend Taylor Swift, fans were quick to catch a small, intimate detail of the couple.

In the third picture of his Instagram carousel, which the Kansas City Chiefs star shared on July 24, the duo is seen matching in black while sitting at a table. Kelce posed with his fingers laced together while Swift held the side her black-rimmed glasses.

However, eagle-eyed fans noticed that the seemingly normal pic had more to it than meets the eye. In the bottom left-hand corner of the photo, the lock screen of a nearby phone reveals another photo of the couple in black and white.
Since the mobile device was near Kelce, many fans theorized that its the tight end's phone, and fans cheered in the comments.
“Me looking at Travis’
phone background,” wrote "Shark Tank" star Barbara Corcoran along with a magnifying glass emoji.
Some fans even pointed out a second phone in the bottom right-hand corner of the screen near a glass, with another photo that fans speculate is another snapshot of the couple.
“The lock screen, I’m screaming, OMG!!!” said one user.
“This is everything!!!!” another user said.
Fans noted other details from the pic in the comments section, like how Travis posted 13 photos in the Instagram carousel, famously known as the pop star's lucky number.
“The fact that there’s 13 pics,” one user said with a happy tears emoji.
“It’s the 13 photos for me,” said another user.
The football player shared other snippets with Swift, like one where they both wore similar hats. Kelce's cap read "captain," while Swift was seen with a "first mate" hat.
Other pictures featured Kelce's friends and family, writing in the caption that he "had some adventures this offseason."

title: How to Do the Nicki Minaj Challenge and Not Hurt Yourself
summary: The Nicki Minaj challenge has taken over TikTok where users recreate her 2013 "High School" pose. But is it safe? Here's what you need to know.
story: TikTok’s newest trend features a gravity defying pose where users perch on a tall stack of random objects, while crossing their legs as they stand on one foot… in heels.

Known as the “Nicki Minaj challenge,” this viral moment is an elaborate balancing act. The challenge has taken over the internet, as the hashtag #nickiminajchallenge has been used over 115,000 times on TikTok alone.

Creators have balanced on everything from Jenga blocks to soup cans. Many have found their own humorous, if not outrageous, ways to embrace the challenge and make it their own. Some have ridden on their kids' play cars while remaining in the pose, while others have used their pets to get in on the action.
As the trend grows in popularity, some are wondering how it all started, and is it safe? Here’s what you need to know about the Nicki Minaj challenge.
Where Did the Nicki Minaj Challenge Come From?

The trend is inspired by rapper Nicki Minaj’s famous pose in the music video for the 2013 song “High School” ft. Lil Wayne. At the video’s 34 second mark, Minaj stands by a swimming pool in stilettos, crouching low to the ground with one leg crossed over the other.
In April, TikTok user @1jacore posted a video attempting to emulate Minaj. Since then, others followed suit, with many getting creative as they tried to channel the singer's impressive posture.

Now, the trend has evolved beyond just completing Minaj’s original pose. Users have taken the challenge to new heights, balancing on as many objects as possible, all while wearing a pair of high heels. The trend also appears to have become somewhat competitive, with some participants seemingly attempting to outdo one another with the most elaborate balancing act.

For example, one user posted a video of herself on TikTok balancing on a tall stack of tables in her garden. In the video, she holds a hose in one hand and balances on an upside down flowerpot while in a pair of heels.
Users have also recorded themselves balancing on champagne bottles, cakes and weights.

On TODAY with Jenna & Friends July 24, Jenna Bush Hager and Willie Geist both attempted the trend. Jenna completed the pose on a stack of books with her July book club pick in hand and a pair of sunglasses on. Willie fulfilled the challenge by balancing on top of ceramic coffee mugs with a margarita in hand.

Some attempts at the trend seem to defy physics and gravity. But as participants try to create the craziest take on the trend yet, they should also consider the safety implications behind completing such a stunt.
Is the Nicki Minaj Challenge Safe?
TODAY fitness contributor Stephanie Mansour tells TODAY.com that the Nicki Minaj challenge can be unsafe if the proper precautions are not taken.
“I never recommend working out in heels or balancing on one foot in heels, unless wearing them is part of the artistic nature of a workout,” Mansour says.
Balancing on unstable objects is risky, she adds. If the proper precautions are not taken, this challenge could be “very dangerous.”
While the challenge is still sweeping social media, Mansour offers her sobering take on whether fans should try to take it on.
“I hate to be the bearer of bad news over a fun TikTok trend,” Mansour says, “but I really don’t recommend that anyone seriously try this.”
How to Safely do the Nicki Minaj Challenge

Even though the Nicki Minaj challenge is not "recommended," there's still hope for those who want to join in on the fun. There are ways to safely complete the challenge and doing it might even have some benefits.
Mansour says balancing workouts can be a great exercise to build strength.

“This could be a great exercise to strengthen your glutes, hamstrings, quads, calf and the stabilizing muscles, tendons and ligaments surrounding your ankle, knee and hip joints,” Mansour says, referring to the challenge.

To complete the trend safely, Mansour recommends balancing on a stable surface, such as a level stack of books. She also says participants should make sure that what they are balancing on is wide enough, which will help them from tipping over.
She says it also would be helpful to have past experience balancing on one foot on surfaces that are not elevated.
After you have the right surface to balance on, and wear a pair of workout shoes, your risk of injury is lower.
Now, all that's left for you to do is bring your own personality to the trend and see what creative items you can grab to feature in your pose.

title: Dwayne Johnson Shares Tribute to 'Childhood Hero' Hulk Hogan After His Death
summary: Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson recalled his incredible WrestleMania X8 match with Hulk Hogan when he paid tribute to the late star after his death.
story: Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson is remembering his late friend and "childhood hero," Hulk Hogan.
One day after Hogan's death, Johnson took to Instagram to pay tribute to the famous wrestler, whose real name is Terry Bollea.
In his post, he shared a video of the time he faced off against Hogan at WrestleMania X8 in 2002, which is often hailed as one of the most iconic matches in history.
In the lengthy caption, Johnson recalled not only their famous fight, but also how he started out as a "lucky kid" who got to meet Hogan.

Johnson recounted going to see Hogan's matchup against Paul "Mr. Wonderful" Orndorff at Madison Square Garden in 1984. During the fight, Johnson said Hogan threw his headband into the crowd, and he was the one that caught it. After the match, he exchanged some words with his idol when he tried to return it.

"You were shocked and so happy after the match because you told me that was your very last headband and if it weren’t for me, you’d have no way of getting that exact one made again," he said. "You promised me that you would get more made and give me a Hulkster headband of my own as a thank you gift.
"A month later in Madison Square Garden, you did just that," Johnson added. "You kept your word, with a handshake and a 'thanks kid.' And that meant the world to that little 12 year old boy."
Flashing forward to when he was 29, Johnson recalled WrestleMania X8 in Toronto.

“I’m standing in the middle of the ring and facing you — one of my wrestling heroes in the main event of WRESTLEMANIA," Johnson wrote. "The match was to decide who would go down in history, as The Greatest of All Time. When you kick out of my Rock Bottom finisher — just listen and FEEL that crowd go ELECTRIC…all for you."

"I’ve never felt anything like that in my entire wrestling career. It takes two to tango, but that historic crowd reaction was all for you," he added. "You may have 'passed the torch' to me that night, but you, my friend…. … you 'drew the house.'"
He called the icon the "greatest of all time" before he wrapped up his post.

"From deep in my bones, and on behalf of this wild and crazy world of professional wrestling that we love, I say to you now, and forever…Thank you for the house, brother… Thank you, for the house. RIP Terry Bollea aka Hulk Hogan 🕊️," he wrote.
On July 24, Hogan died after suffering a sudden cardiac arrest, local authorities in Clearwater, Florida, said. He was 71.

The icon is survived by his children, Brooke and Nick, and his wife, Sky Daily. He died "surrounded by his loved ones," according to an official statement shared to Hogan's social media accounts July 24.

title: Is There a ‘The Fantastic Four: First Steps’ Post-Credit Scene?
summary: Find out how the film ends and if fans should stick around for a post-credit scene.
story: Warning: Spoilers ahead for “The Fantastic Four: First Steps.”
Marvel’s first family is back on the big screen for the MCU’s latest film, “The Fantastic Four: First Steps,” re-introducing fans to Mister Fantastic, Invisible Woman, Human Torch and The Thing.

For the new superhero flick, which hit theaters July 25, Pedro Pascal steps into the role of Reed Richards while Vanessa Kirby plays Sue Storm. Completing the family are Joseph Quinn’s Johnny Storm, Sue’s brother, and Ebon Moss-Bachrach’s character Ben Grimm, Reed’s close friend.

Straying from the early 2000s “Fantastic Four” films and the widely panned 2015 reboot, this time comic book fans meet Reed, Sue, Johnny and Ben on Earth-828 circa the early 1960s, as evident by the movie’s glossy retro-futuristic style.

The film breezes past the characters’ origin stories, showing in flashbacks how their previous trip to space resulted in them returning to Earth with superpowers. But the beloved heroes of this world are rattled when one day the Silver Surfer, played by Julia Garner, descends from the sky and announces to the quartet, and the world, that their planet is marked for death. She tells them that Earth will be consumed by a colossal being known as Galactus, voiced by Ralph Ineson.
Reed, Sue, Johnny and Ben then try to come up with a plan to protect their planet while also preparing for the arrival of Reed and Sue’s baby boy.

So, what happens during their battle with Galactus, and are there any post-credit scenes that reveal when fans will see the Fantastic Four again? Read on to find out how “The Fantastic Four: First Steps” ends and if there are any additional scenes after the credits start rolling.
Is there a post-credit scene at the end of ‘The Fantastic Four: First Steps’?
Marvel is gifting fans with two post-credit scenes in “The Fantastic Four: First Steps,” one of which hints at how the next part of Phase Six will unfold.

In the final act of the movie, Reed, Sue, Johnny and Ben are able to prevent Galactus from eating their planet and taking Reed and Sue’s newborn baby, Franklin. Galactus had asked the couple to sacrifice their child to him and in exchange he would leave their planet alone. He reveals that Franklin has special abilities that would eliminate the giant’s insatiable hunger, even though Reed’s multiple tests appeared to confirm the baby lacked superpowers.

Instead of giving into Galactus’ demand, the quartet outsmart him by luring the entity into a trap. However, the plan goes awry and Sue has to use all her strength to create a force field strong enough to push Galactus into a portal that sends him to a far part of the galaxy.
Sue dies but when Reed places Franklin on top of her, the boy suddenly revives her.

The film ends and a few credits roll before we check in on Sue and Franklin four years later in the first post-credit scene. Sue finishes reading a book to Franklin in the Fantastic Four’s penthouse apartment, located at the Baxter Building, before she goes into another room to grab a second novel.

When she returns to the living room, she senses something is wrong and spots Doctor Doom leaning over the child. Although the villain has his mask removed in the scene and holds it in his hand, his face is not shown. Marvel has previously announced that Robert Downey Jr., who portrayed Iron Man, will re-join the MCU as Doctor Doom.
The flick then cuts to a black screen with text that reads, “The Fantastic Four will return in ‘Avengers: Doomsday.’”

Once all the credits conclude, the film officially ends with a snippet from the 1967 “Fantastic Four” cartoon. There is also a quote from Jack Kirby, who co-created the Fantastic Four with the late Stan Lee, as well as many other comic book characters prior to his death in 1994. The quote from Kirby says, “If you look at my characters, you will find me. No matter what kind of character you create or assume, a little of yourself must remain there.”
How does the post-credit scene impact ‘Avengers: Doomsday’?

Doctor Doom finally making an appearance in a Marvel film isn’t that surprising given that he will be the main “Big Bad” for this phase of the MCU and that he is one of the Fantastic Four’s biggest adversaries. Plus, Pascal, Kirby, Quinn and Moss-Bachrach were previously announced as “Avengers: Doomsday” cast members in March.

However, as mentioned, “First Steps” is set in the 1960s, decades before the timelines of Marvel’s other films this year, like “Captain America: Brave New World” and “Thunderbolts*.” So, Doctor Doom popping up in this movie could suggest there will be some type of time travel element at the center of “Avengers: Doomsday.”

Fans will see the Fantastic Four don their blue suits again alongside other co-stars like Chris Hemsworth, Anthony Mackie, Florence Pugh, James Marsden and more when “Avengers: Doomsday” arrives in theaters December 18, 2026.

title: Matt Healy's Mom Says She's 'Glad' Not To Be Taylor Swift's Mother-In-Law
summary: Matt Healy’s mom Denise Welch opened up about her son’s former relationship with Taylor Swift.
story: Taylor Swift never married Matt Healy — and his mom is relieved about that.
“Not being her mother-in-law is a role that I am glad that I lost,” Denise Welch, who is Matt Healy’s mom, told Andy Cohen on a July 24 episode of “Watch What Happens Live.”
Welch spoke up after Cohen asked, “Ms. Swift wrote a whole album about their relationship ... What was your reaction to that album?”
Although Swift and Healy (the frontman of the band “The 1975”) never confirmed they were dating, fans suspect their 2023 connection inspired Swift’s latest album, “The Tortured Poets Department.”
“Not that I have anything against her at all,” Welch said of Swift after the “Watch What Happens Live" audience took a sharp breath.

“It was just, you know, it was tricky,” added Welch. “Listen — you’re not allowed to say anything and then she writes a whole album about it. But Matty has taken it all in completely good grace. He is very happy with his amazing fiancée Gabbriette.”
Welch, an actress whose credits include the popular British series "Coronation Street," told Cohen that her future-daughter-in-law is “gorgeous,” adding, “We’ve moved on.”
In 2024, Matt proposed to musician-model Gabbriette Bechtel, which Welch shared on the British talk show “Loose Women.”
“I couldn’t be more thrilled,” Welch said at the time.
Taylor Swift has been dating Travis Kelce, a tight end for the Kansas City Chiefs football team, since approximately mid-2023.
Taylor Swift and Matt Healy’s romantic timeline
Taylor Swift met the English rocker for the first time in 2014, as previously reported by TODAY.com.
“I met Taylor Swift, that was really nice,” Matt told an Australian radio host, via E! News. “We exchanged numbers. Let’s see what happens.”
When the host speculated whether Swift and Healy would date each other, Healy responded, “I mean bloody hell, what am I going to do? Go out with Taylor Swift? She’s a sensation, I wouldn’t say no.”
Rumors that Swift and Healy were dating arose in 2023, when Swift performed at “The 1975” London concert.
At the concert, Welch posted an Instagram photo of herself and Swift, writing, “Oh what a night at a sold out 02. So proud I can’t even begin!!”
In June 2023, a “source” told People that Swift and Matt had broken up.

title: Hulk Hogan’s Wife Breaks Silence After His Death: ‘My Heart Is In Pieces’
summary: Hulk Hogan’s widow, Sky Daily, wrote an Instagram post sharing her feelings about the wrestling legend's death.
story: Hulk Hogan’s wife, Sky Daily, is speaking out after the wrestling legend died July 24 at the age of 71.
“I wasn’t ready for this…and my heart is in pieces,” she wrote in an emotional tribute on Instagram, accompanied by a close-up photo of her kissing Hogan on the cheek.

Hogan, whose real name was Terry Bollea, died after suffering a cardiac arrest, per local authorities in Clearwater, Florida. Daily wrote she's having a difficult time coming to terms with his death, alluding to the wrestler's previous ailments.
“He had been dealing with some health issues, but I truly believed we would overcome them. I had so much faith in his strength. I thought we still had more time,” she wrote.
“This loss is sudden and impossible to process. To the world, he was a legend… but to me, he was my Terry. The man I loved. My partner. My heart," she continued.
Daily also said her husband adored his supporters and fought through pain to meet them when he could.

“Hulk loved his fans so much and despite his growing physical discomfort, he did everything he could to show up, sign autographs, take photos, and connect with the people who supported him through it all. You meant everything to him,” she wrote.

“He was a believer in Christ, and I take comfort knowing his soul is at peace and he’s been welcomed home," she added. "Please keep his family and all of us who loved him in your prayers as we try to navigate this new reality.”
Hogan and Daily married in 2023. “My new life starts now!” Hogan captioned a video on Instagram about their wedding.

Hogan was previously married to Linda Hogan from 1983 until 2009. The couple had two kids, Brooke and Nick. In 2010, he married Jennifer McDaniel, before revealing on social media in 2022 that they had divorced.
Hulk Hogan's official social media accounts shared a statement July 24 confirming the wrestling pro's death.
"Our beloved Terry Bollea, known worldwide as Hulk Hogan, passed away today surrounded by his loved ones,” the statement, which was posted on Hogan’s Instagram and Facebook accounts, read in part.

title: 'Love on the Spectrum' Star Madison Marilla Meets Zac Brown on TODAY: 'I Wish Tyler Was Here
summary: 'Love on the Spectrum' star Madison Marilla joined Zac Brown on stage during his Citi Concert Series performance to share her rendition of "Chicken Fried."
story: “Love on the Spectrum” star Madison Marilla received a special surprise when she got to meet country music singer Zac Brown during his TODAY Citi Concert Series performance on July 25.
An avid country fan, Marilla told Al Roker on TODAY that she traveled from Tampa, Florida with her family to see the Zac Brown Band concert on the TODAY Plaza.
After the group performed a few of their hits, Brown brought Marilla up on stage to say a special hello.
“I’m a huge fan. I’ve always wanted to see you in concert,” Marilla told Brown on stage. “‘Chicken Fried’ and ‘Toes’ are my favorite.”
Brown told Marilla he would love for her to attend one of her concerts. Then, Marilla took the mic and began to sing “Chicken Fried” for the audience and was met with cheers.
“I wish Tyler was here,” Marilla said after singing the song.
Marilla met her boyfriend Tyler White on “Love on the Spectrum.” The reality series follows adults across the autism spectrum as they search for love.
On the show, Marilla and White bonded over their love for country music. Marilla told Brown she and White spoke about his songs on their first date.
While he couldn’t be there to see singer in person, after the concert, White, who is a musician himself, FaceTimed with Brown to say hello.
“You’ve got an amazing ear for music,” Bryan told White over FaceTime. “It’s amazing how much you know about music. I was really impressed on the show.”
Brown, who recently announced his engagement to jewelry designer Kendra Scott, also chatted with Marilla about her love for making jewelry.
Marilla also met Scott after the concert and gave her a bracelet. She told TODAY.com what the moment means for her.
“It was fun meeting a famous jewelry designer,” Marilla said. “My dream is to own my own store one day.”

title: Who Is Andrea Preti? Meet the Actor Who Stole Venus Williams' Heart
summary: Venus Williams has scored a love match and it's off the court. Meet her model fiancé, Andrea Preti.
story: Venus Williams has scored a love match, and it's off the court.
On July 22, following her first singles match in more than a year, Williams revealed that she is engaged to actor and former model Andre Preti.
While speaking to WTA following her DC Open singles match, the tennis star, who sported a diamond ring on her left finger, called Preti her fiancé.
“My fiancé is here and he really encouraged me to keep playing,” she explained, noting it was the first time Preti had seen her play.
While the engagement is newly confirmed, Williams made her first public appearance with Preti in 2024. There's plenty to learn about the man who won big in the tennis star's heart.
Read on to learn all about Andre Preti.
He’s Originally From Denmark
Andrea Preti was born in Copenhagen, Denmark, on June 6, 1988, according to his IMDB page.
He’s Lived In Italy
As a teenager, Preti moved with his family to Italy, where he was first introduced to the world of fashion.
He’s a Former Model
While living in Italy, Preti decided to pursue modeling full-time and eventually became a familiar face in the modeling industry.
In an interview with Affashionate.com, Preti shared that his first modeling job was for Gucci. "It was a presentation that involved boutiques all over Italy," he explained.
During his career, he walked the runway for John Richmond at Milan Fashion Week for both the Spring/Summer 2013 and Autumn/Winter 2013 collections.
Still, Preti has said in the past that modeling wasn't his original aim. Speaking to Affashionate.com, he explained that it was his parents who urged him to consider the catwalk.

"I never dreamed of doing fashion. My parents push me to do that," he explained. "In the beginning, I went to several agencies showing my photos, but they were so bad that I was not even considered. Then my father let me introduce myself to Domenico Zambelli, he carried me by Bruno, from the D Management, who told me these words: 'The pictures are disgusting, but I believe in you.' And from there it all started. However, I owe it all to Domenico."
Preti has modeled for top fashion houses like Dolce & Gabbana, Moncler, and Corneliani.

Now, a decade later, the actor remains tied to the fashion world, having attended the Gucci Men's Spring/ Summer 2025 show in Milan in June 2024, where he was spotted sitting in the front row at the event. He often posts about some of the campaigns he's worked on, such as collaborating with Tommy Hilfiger in Florence, Italy.
He Studied Acting in New York
On the heels of his modeling success, Preti relocated to New York City to attend the Susan Baston Academy, where he trained to become a professional actor.
He’s an Actor and Producer
Preti's IMDb page notes that he has worked in film, television, and commercials, and has starred in various projects, as well as taken on roles as a producer.

Some of his projects include "One More Day" (2015), “Detective per Caso” (2018), “My Beloved Enemy” (2018) — which he also produced —, “Girls to Buy” (2021), “Temptation” (2023), and a 2021 television series titled “A Professor.”
He and Venus Williams Were Spotted Together in 2024

The couple were seen enjoying each other's company during a trip to Nerano, Italy along the Amalfi Coast back in July 2024, according to People. The two caught rays and attention while appearing happy on a boat ride.
Their Love Language
While they have kept much of their relationship private, Williams and Preti’s social media interactions offer a glimpse into their chemistry and connection.

In June, Preti, who was born in Denmark and raised in Italy, offered a glimpse into their multilingual banter when he shared a promotional post from a Tommy Hilfiger modeling campaign on Instagram. The post included a carousel of photos of the actor modeling clothing for the brand. In the comments section of the post, Williams “Le mien” — French for “Mine.” Preti replied with “si,” the Italian word for “yes.”
Venus Seen Wearing a Diamond Ring

In February 2025, Williams and Preti set off rumors of their engagement when the tennis star was seen in Rome wearing a diamond ring on her engagement finger. At the time, People obtained photos of Williams and Preti having a PDA moment outside. The outlet also zoomed in on a photo of Williams wearing a diamond ring during a training session. Despite all signs pointing to an engagement, neither had publicly confirmed that they were gearing up to tie the knot.
Venus Confirmed Her Engagement to Preti in July 2024
On July 22, the tennis star confirmed her engagement to the actor after her Mubadala Citi DC Open singles match.
“My fiancé is here and he really encouraged me to keep playing,” Williams said during an interview with WTA after her match in which she spoke about his support of her and the sport.

“There were so many times where I just wanted to coast and kind of chill,” she said during the interview. “Do you know how hard it is to play tennis? You guys don’t know how much work goes into this, like it’s 9 to 5 except you’re running the whole time, lifting weights and just like dying and then you repeat it the next day."
So he encouraged me to get through this, and it’s wonderful to be here. He’s never seen me play,” she added.

title: Winona Ryder Shares Al Pacino’s 3-Word Response After She Fell 'In Love' With Him
summary: Winona Ryder recalled the crush she used to have on Al Pacino in the '90s and said she was "absolutely in love" with him.
story: Winona Ryder is getting candid about her relationship with Al Pacino.

During an interview with Elle that was published on July 23, she said there used to be a time when she was “absolutely in love” with the “Godfather” actor. Ryder explained that she felt a great deal of feelings towards Pacino when they worked together on a "Richard III" workshop, which later turned into their 1996 film, "Looking for Richard."

"We were doing that workshop for 'Richard III,' which I didn’t know was gonna be a movie. I was actively in love with him," she said. "He was obsessed with coffee, and he would take me all over New York — like, to the weirdest places — to try different coffees."
"I’m 22, or whatever. Finally, he’s dropping me off wherever I’m staying, and I’m like, 'I love you, you know. I really am completely in love with you,'" she continued.
Ryder said Pacino then reached out to touch her hand and told her, "Aw, honey, noooo."
"Then, like 10 years later, I meet his girlfriend, who’s younger than me," she laughed. "Dude, I’m f---ing throwing myself at you."
Ryder explained that she still has a good relationship with Pacino. She said that sometimes they play poker together.
"It’s the best," she said.

Ryder has since moved on. She's currently in a long-term relationship with her boyfriend, Scott Mackinlay Hahn. As for Pacino, he's been in a couple of relationships since the '90s, but like Ryder, he's never been married.
Other than Hahn, Ryder has been linked to other famous men in Hollywood, such as Johnny Depp and her “Bram Stoker’s Dracula" co-star Keanu Reeves.

In a 2018 interview with Entertainment Weekly, Ryder talked about the long-running joke that she might actually be married to Reeves in real life because they had real priests at their fake wedding ceremony for their "Dracula" movie.
“We actually got married in ‘Dracula.’ No, I swear to god I think we’re married in real life,” she joked.

title: Where Is the Cast of 'Happy Gilmore' Now? Plus, See Who's Returning for the Sequel
summary: See the cast of Happy Gilmore then and now.
story: Almost 30 years ago, Adam Sandler starred in "Happy Gilmore," the 1996 movie about a failed ice hockey player who takes up golf to stop the foreclosure of his grandmother’s house.
Considered a classic among comedy fans, professional golfers and children of the '90s, "Happy Gilmore" features a stacked cast with a multitude of celebrity cameos.

This summer, Sandler returned to the golf course with "Happy Gilmore 2," out July 25 on Netflix. Directed by Kyle Newacheck and written by Tim Herlihy and Adam Sandler, the sequel features new roles for Bad Bunny, Margaret Qualley and Benny Safdie.
Let’s peek at what the original cast has been up to since the 1996 premiere.
Adam Sandler (Happy Gilmore)
Who else would we start with other than the one and only Mr. Landon “Happy” Gilmore?

Adam Sandler has stayed busy since nailing that final putt. He was a staple of '90s and early aughts comedies, but also appeared in more dramatic roles, like "Punch Drunk Love" and "Uncut Gems." In addition to writing, acting, and producing multiple Hollywood projects, Sandler also performs stand-up.
His two daughters with wife Jackie Sandler are frequent co-contributors and appear in "Happy Gilmore 2" with him.
Plus, don't forget his legacy as a Gen-Z style icon.
Julie Bowen (Virginia Venit)

Since stealing hearts in "Happy Gilmore," Emmy-award winning Julie Bowen starred in multiple hit television shows, such as "Ed," "Boston Legal," and, of course, "Modern Family," where she played Claire Dunphy.
"Happy Gilmore 2" won’t be the first time she reunited with Adam Sandler. In 2020, Bowen and Sandler returned as love interests in the Netflix comedy, "Hubie Halloween."
Bowen said she didn't expect to be brought back for the "Happy Gilmore" sequel.

“I didn’t think they’d bring me back at all,” Bowen said on the most "Inside of You" podcast hosted by Michael Rosenbaum. “I mean, who am I supposed to be? He’s got to have a younger woman in this one.”
“Adam’s like, ‘Stop saying that. You’re the heart of the movie,’” she continued.
Fans were shocked by Virginia's fate in the sequel.
Christopher McDonald (Shooter McGavin)
